get.description: This call returns the file path information. This information can be used with the response of the locations calls to create a URI to retrieve files.

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: The DAM ID for which to retrieve file path info.

get.description: Gives information about return types of the different versions of the APIs
Gives information about return types of the different versions of the APIs

This call returns the file path information for audio files within a volume
               This information can be used with the response of the /audio/location call to create
               a URI to retrieve the audio files.

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: The DAM ID for which to retrieve file path info.

parameters.name: chapter_id
parameters.description: If this value is the return will be limited to the provided chapter

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The audio encoding format desired (No longer in use as Audio Files default to mp3).

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset id that contains the resource.

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: The USFM 2.4 book ID.

get.summary: Returns Audio timestamps for a specific reference
get.description:
This route will return timestamps restricted to specific book and chapter
               combination for a fileset. Note that the fileset id must be available via the path
               `/timestamps`. At first, only a few filesets may have timestamps metadata applied.

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The specific fileset to return references for

parameters.name: book
parameters.description: The Book ID for which to return timestamps

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: The chapter for which to return timestamps

get.description:
This route offers information about the media distribution servers and the
               protocols they support. It is currently depreciated and only remains to account for
               the possibility that someone might still be using this old method of uri generation

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The specific fileset to return references for

parameters.name: book
parameters.description: The Book ID for which to return timestamps

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: The chapter for which to return timestamps

get.description: Gets the book order and code listing for a volume.

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: The bible ID

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The Asset ID

get.description: Gets the book order and code listing for a volume.

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The language_code

get.description: Lists the chapters for a book or all books in a standard bible volume.

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: The bible_id

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset_id

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: The book_id

get.summary: This returns copyright and associated organizations info.

get.description:
This call returns the file path information for audio files for a volume. This information can
    be used with the response of the /audio/location call to create a URI to retrieve the audio files.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The abbreviated `BibleFileset` id created from the letters after the iso

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the version in the language that it's written in

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The name of the version in english

get.description: This call gets the event history for volume changes to status, expiry, basic info, delivery, and organization association. The event reflects the previous state of the volume. In other words, it reflects the state up to the moment of the time of the event.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The Number of records to return

get.description: This method retrieves the available volumes in the system according to the filter specified

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: The Bible Id

parameters.name: fcbh_id
parameters.description: An alternative query name for the bible id

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: If set, will filter results by the type of media for which filesets are available.

externalDocs.description: For a complete list of media types please see the v4_bible_filesets.types route

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language to filter results by

parameters.name: full_word
parameters.description:
Consider the language name as being a full word. For instance, when false,
    'new' will return volumes where the string 'new' is anywhere in the language name,
    like in `Newari` and `Awa for Papua New Guinea`. When true, it will only return volumes
    where the language name contains the word 'new', like in `Awa for Papua New Guinea`.

parameters.name: language_name
parameters.description: The language name to filter results by. For a complete list see the `/languages` route

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The iso code to filter results by. This will return results only in the language specified.

parameters.name: language_family_code
parameters.description: The iso code of the trade language to filter results by. This will also return all dialects of a language. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route

parameters.name: updated
parameters.description: The last time updated

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The owning organization to return bibles for. For a complete list see the `/organizations` route

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The any field to within the bible model may be selected as the value for this `sort_by` param.

parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: The direction to sort by the field specified in `sort_by`. Either `asc` or `desc`

parameters.name: filter_by_fileset
parameters.description: This field defaults to true but when set to false will return all Bible entries regardless of whether or not the API has content for that biblical text.

get.description: V2's base fileset route

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The Bible fileset ID

parameters.name: book
parameters.description: The Book ID

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: The chapter number

get.description: Some languages used by the Digital Bible Platform utilize character sets that are not supported by `standard` fonts. This call provides a list of custom fonts that have been made available.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the font to retrieve

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search for a specific font by name

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Only return fonts that have been authorized for the specified platform. Available values are: `android`, `ios`, `web`, or `all`

get.description: trans_v2_text_search_group.description

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: trans_v2_text_search_group.param_query

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: trans_v2_text_search_group.param_dam_id

get.description: This method retrieves the bible verse info for the specified volume/book/chapter.

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: the DAM ID of the verse info

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: If specified returns verse text ONLY for the specified book

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: If specified returns verse text ONLY for the specified chapter

parameters.name: verse_start
parameters.description: Returns all verse text for the specified book, chapter, and verse range from 'verse_start' until either the end of chapter or 'verse_end'

parameters.name: verse_end
parameters.description: If specified returns of all verse text for the specified book, chapter, and verse range from 'verse_start' to 'verse_end'.

get.summary: Information about the media distribution servers & protocols
get.description: This method allows the caller to retrieve information about the media distribution servers and protocols they support.

parameters.name: video_server_bucket
parameters.description: The server's bucket

parameters.name: video_server_alias
parameters.description: The server's alias

parameters.name: dam_id
parameters.description: DAM ID for the video volume desired

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The video encoding format desired

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Resolution of video files requested corresponding to the basic categories of low, medium, and high. The default is 'lo'. DBT will determine if the volume is configured for the requested resolution. If not, it will return the next highest resolution to the requested resolution for which the volume is configured

parameters.name: segment_order
parameters.description: The order number of the video segment in the volume. This is particularly useful for story volumes as there are no applicable OSIS or USFM book codes.

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: The USFM/OSIS book code may be used to filter segments by references to book desired.

parameters.name: chapter_id
parameters.description: Chapter id to filter segments by references based on book and chapter.

parameters.name: verse_id
parameters.description: Verse id to filter segments by references based on book, chapter and verse.

get.description: Returns the List of Languages

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Get the entry for a three letter language code

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Get the entry for a part of a language name in either native language or English

parameters.name: full_word
parameters.description: Consider the language name as being a full word. For instance, when false, 'new' will return volumes where the string new is anywhere in the language name, like in Newari and Awa for Papua New Guinea. When true, it will only return volumes where the language name contains the full word 'new', like in `Awa for Papua New Guinea`. Default is false

parameters.name: family_only
parameters.description: When set to true the returned list is of only legal language families. The default is false

parameters.name: possibilities
parameters.description: When set to true the returned list is a combination of DBP languages and ISO languages not yet defined in DBP that meet any of the criteria

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Primary criteria by which to sort. 'name' refers to the native language name. The default is 'english'

get.summary: Returns Languages and the countries associated with them
get.description:
Filter languages by a specified country code or filter countries by specified language code.
               Country flags can also be retrieved by requesting one of the permitted image sizes. Languages can also be
               sorted by the country code (default) and the language code.

parameters.name: lang_code
parameters.description: Get records by ISO language code

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: Get records by ISO country code

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Get colon separated list of optional countries

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort by lang_code or country_code

parameters.name: img_type
parameters.description: Includes a country flag image of the specified file type

parameters.name: img_size
parameters.description:
Include country flags in entries in requested size. This no longer generates images but
                   rather selects them from a recommended list: 40x30, 80x60, 160X120, 320X240, 640X480, or 1280X960

get.description:
This method retrieves the list of languages for available volumes and the related volume data in
               the system according to the filter specified.

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The three letter language code

parameters.name: root
parameters.description: Can be used to restrict the response to only languages that start with Quechua for example.

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: The format of languages the caller is interested in.

parameters.name: full_word
parameters.description:
Consider the language name as being a full word. For instance, when false, `cat` will return
                   volumes where the string cat is anywhere in the language name like `catalan` and `Cuicatec, Teutila`.
                   This value defaults to false.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Publishing status of volume. The default is live

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The organization id to filter languages by.

get.description:
This method retrieves the list of language families for available volumes and the related volume
               data in the system according to the filter specified.

server.description: Returns an array of signed audio urls

root_path.description: Returns an array of signed audio urls

protocol.description: Returns an array of signed audio urls

CDN.description: Returns an array of signed audio urls

priority.description: Returns an array of signed audio urls

volume_id.description: Returns an array of signed audio urls

v2_api_versionLatest.title: v2_api_versionLatest
v2_api_versionLatest.description: The return for the api reply

Version.description: Returns an array of version return types

v2_api_apiReply.title: v2_api_apiReply
v2_api_apiReply.description: The return for the api reply

v2_library_version.title: v2_library_version
v2_library_version.description: The various version ids in the old version 2 style

version_code.description: The abbreviated `BibleFileset` id created from letters after the iso code

version_name.description: The name of the version in the language that it's written in

english_name.description: The name of the version in english

v4_api_assets.title: The assets response
v4_api_assets.description: The aws assets currently being used by the api

id.title: id
id.description: The Archivist created Bible ID string. This will be between six and twelve letters usually starting with the iso639-3 code and ending with the acronym for the Bible

date.title: date
date.description: The year the Bible was originally published

derived.title: derived
derived.description: This field indicates the `bible_id` of the Scriptures that the current Scriptures being described are derived. For example, because the NIrV (New International Reader's Version) was created from / inspired by the NIV (New International Version). If this model was describing ENGNIRV the derived field would be ENGNIV.

copyright.title: copyright
copyright.description: A short copyright description for the bible text.

in_progress.title: in_progress
in_progress.description: If the Bible being described is currently in progress.

versification.title: versification
versification.description: The versification system for ordering books and chapters

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp at which the bible was originally created

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp at which the bible was last updated

BibleBook.title: Bible Book
BibleBook.description: The Bible Book Model stores the vernacular book titles and chapters

name.title: name
name.description: The name of the book in the language of the bible

name_short.title: name_short
name_short.description: If the vernacular name has an abbreviated form, it will be stored hre

chapters.title: chapters
chapters.description: A string of the chapters in the book separated by a comma

BibleEquivalent.title: BibleEquivalent
BibleEquivalent.description: The Bible Equivalent Model stores the connections between the bible IDs and external organizations

type.title: type
type.description: The type of connection that the equivalent id refers to

site.title: site
site.description: The name of the site/organization/app where the equivalent id is based

suffix.title: site
suffix.description: Additional metadata affecting the type of equivalent connection

constructed_url.title: Constructed Url
constructed_url.description: The full path to the resource which the equivalent describes

BibleFile.title: BibleFile
BibleFile.description: The Bible File Model communicates information about biblical files stored in S3

id.title: id
id.description: The id

chapter_end.title: chapter_end
chapter_end.description: If the Bible File spans multiple chapters this field indicates the last chapter of the selection

verse_start.title: verse_start
verse_start.description: The starting verse at which the BibleFile reference begins

verse_end.title: verse_end
verse_end.description: If the Bible File spans multiple verses this value will indicate the last verse in that reference. This value is inclusive, so for the reference John 1:1-4. The value would be 4 and the reference would contain verse 4.

verse_text.title: verse_text
verse_text.description: If the BibleFile model returns text instead of a file_name this field will contain it.
verse_text.example: And God said unto Abraham, And as for thee, thou shalt keep my covenant, thou, and thy seed after thee throughout their generations.

duration.title: duration
duration.description: If the file has a set length of time, this field indicates that time in milliseconds

BibleFileTimestamp.title: Bible File Timestamp
BibleFileTimestamp.description: The Bible File Timestamp tag model partitions the file into verse by verse sections

id.title: file_id
id.description: The incrementing id of the file timestamp

verse_start.title: verse_start
verse_start.description: The starting verse for the file timestamp

verse_end.title: verse_end
verse_end.description: The ending verse for the file timestamp

timestamp.title: timestamp
timestamp.description: The ending verse for the file timestamp

BibleFileTitle.title: BibleFileTitle
BibleFileTitle.description: The Bible File Title model communicates information about generalized fileset sizes

file_id.title: file_id
file_id.description: The incrementing id of the file timestamp

iso.title: iso

description.title: description
description.description: The description of the file title

id.title: id
id.description: The fileset id

hash_id.title: hash_id
hash_id.description: The hash_id generated from the `asset_id`, `set_type_code`, and `id`

asset_id.title: asset_id
asset_id.description: The asset id of the AWS Bucket or CloudFront instance

set_type_code.title: set_type_code
set_type_code.description: The set_type_code indicating the type of the fileset

set_size_code.title: set_size_code
set_size_code.description: The set_size_code indicating the size of the fileset

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp at which the fileset was last updated

BibleFilesetType.description: The Bible Fileset Type model communicates general metadata about the bible_filesets.set_size_code

nrsva_order.title: nrsva_order

catholic_order.title: catholic_order

finnish_order.title: finnish_order

testament_order.description: The standard book order within a testament in ascending order from Genesis to Malachi, and Matthew to Revelations

book_testament.description: A short code identifying the testament containing the book

book_group.description: An english name for the section of books that current book can be categorized in

notes.title: notes

updated_at.title: updated_at

name.title: name

name_long.title: name_long

name_short.title: name_short
name_short.description: The short form of the translated name

name_abbreviation.title: name_abbreviation

updated_at.title: updated_at

ON.title: Old and New Testament
ON.description: The translated string for the combined testaments of the bible

OT.title: Old Testament
OT.description: The translated string for the old testament of the bible

NT.title: New Testament
NT.description: The translated string for the new testament of the bible

AP.title: Apocrypha
AP.description: The translated string for the collected apocryphal books

VU.title: Vulgate
VU.description: The translation string for the Vulgate

ET.title: Ethiopian Orthodox Canon/Geez Translation Additions
ET.description: The translation string for the Ethiopian Orthodox order for books of the bible

CO.title: Coptic Orthodox Canon Additions
CO.description: The translation string for the Coptic Orthodox order for books of the bible

AO.title: Armenian Orthodox Canon Additions
AO.description: The translation string for the Armenian Orthodox order for books of the bible

CS.title: Codex Sinaiticus
CS.description: The translation string for Codex Sinaiticus

Gen.title: Genesis
Gen.description: The translation string for the book Genesis

Video.title: VideoTranslations
Video.description: The Video model holds information about biblical films. It serves as a wrapper for all Video{Value} Models including VideoTags and VideoTranslations.

VideoTag.title: VideoTags
VideoTag.description: The VideoTags model holds miscellaneous information about the video model.

id.title: id
id.description: The incrementing id of the video tag

id.title: Country Iso 3166-1
id.description: The Country ID for the country aligning with the ISO 3166-1 standard

externalDocs.description: For more info please refer to the Iso Registration Authority

iso_a3.title: Country Iso 3166-3
iso_a3.description: The Country iso for the country aligning with the ISO 3166-3 standard

externalDocs.description: For more info please refer to the Iso Wiki

fips.title: FIPS ID
fips.description: The Country id for the country aligning with the FIPS standard of the United Nations

externalDocs.description: For more info please refer to the FIPS Wiki

continent.title: continent ID
continent.description: The continent code for the country

name.title: Country Name
name.description: The name for the country in English

introduction.title: Country introduction
introduction.description: A brief description of the country in English
introduction.example: The landlocked Principality of Andorra is one of the smallest states in Europe, nestled high in the Pyrenees...

country_id.title: continent ID
country_id.description: The continent code for the country

CountryCommunication.title: Country Communication
CountryCommunication.description: The Country Communication Model stores information about the communication infrastructure of a country as reported by the CIA's World Factbook

fixed_phones_total.title: fixed_phones_total
fixed_phones_total.description: The `fixed_phones_total` field indicates the approximate number of phones utilizing landlines within a country

fixed_phones_subs_per_100.title: fixed_phones_subs_per_100
fixed_phones_subs_per_100.description: The `fixed_phones_subs_per_100` field describes the approximate number of landline phone subscriptions per 100 people. This gives a sense of the prevalence of landline phone use within a population.

mobile_phones_total.title: mobile_phones_total
mobile_phones_total.description: The `mobile_phones_total` field describes the total approximate number of cellphones within a country

mobile_phones_subs_per_100.title: mobile_phones_subs_per_100
mobile_phones_subs_per_100.description: The `mobile_phones_subs_per_100` field describes the total approximate number of cellphone subscriptions within the country per 100 people. This gives a sense of the prevalence of cellphone use within a population.

phone_system_general_assessment.title: phone_system_general_assessment
phone_system_general_assessment.description: The `phone_system_general_assessment` field describes the general state of the telephone system within the country.
phone_system_general_assessment.example: Sparse system of open-wire, radiotelephone communications, and low-capacity microwave radio relays

phone_system_international.title: phone_system_international
phone_system_international.description: The `phone_system_international` field indicates the international phone code and satellite position for a country.

externalDocs.description: For a full list of country phone codes please refer to Wikipedia

phone_system_international.example: country code - 257; satellite earth station - 1 Intelsat (Indian Ocean) (2015)

phone_system_domestic.title: phone_system_domestic
phone_system_domestic.description: This field gives a general assessment of the status of the domestic phone system.
phone_system_domestic.example: Fixed-line teledensity of only about 6 per 100 persons; mobile-cellular teledensity approaching 50 per 100 persons

broadcast_media.title: broadcast_media
broadcast_media.description: This field indicates the independence and connections between the different companies that operate within the country
broadcast_media.example: 4 state-controlled national TV channels; Polish and Russian TV broadcasts are available in some areas...

internet_country_code.title: internet_country_code
internet_country_code.description: The TLD extension, Top Level Domain, for the country

externalDocs.description: For a full list of top level domains

internet_total_users.title: internet_total_users
internet_total_users.description: The number of people who have access to the internet.

internet_population_percent.title: internet_population_percent
internet_population_percent.description: The percent of the populace who have access to the internet

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The created_at timestamp for the Communications Model

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The updated_at timestamp for the Communications Model

CountryEconomy.title: Country Economy
CountryEconomy.description: The Country Economy Model stores information about the economic status of a country as reported by the CIA's World Factbook

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: A general overview of the countries economic status.
overview.example: Afghanistan's economy is recovering from decades of conflict. The economy has improved significantly since the fall of the Taliban regime in 2001 largely because of the infusion of international assistance, the recovery of the agricultural sector, and service sector growth...

gdp_power_parity.title: GDP (purchasing power parity)

gdp_power_parity.example: $64.08 billion (2016 est.) ++ $62.82 billion (2015 est.) ++ $62.35 billion (2014 est.)

household_income_highest_10.description: Household income or consumption by percentage share; highest 10%

CountryEnergy.title: Country Energy
